# Experimental Design and Modeling Services for Oil Dispersion in Water
## Notice ID: cb-827-19941414

### Tender Details
* **Title (English)**: Experimental Design, Modeling and Testing of Oil Dispersion in Water: Influence of Wind and Formation of Emulsions
* **Title (French)**: Conception expérimentale, modélisation et essai de dispersion pétrole dans eau : influence vent et formation emulsion
* **Reference Number**: 30004990
* **Tender Closing Date**: March 21, 2024, 2:00 PM Eastern Time
* **Regions of Delivery**: Nova Scotia (Canada)

### About the Tender
The Government of Canada, through Fisheries and Oceans Canada, seeks to award a contract for experimental design, modeling, and testing of oil dispersion in water, focusing on the influence of wind and the formation of emulsions. This project aims to provide scientific information to support environmental response initiatives, particularly under the Oceans Protection Plan (OPP 2.0). The contract will be conducted over multiple years, with expected completion by March 12, 2027.

### Special Conditions
This tender is conditionally set-aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more bids from Indigenous businesses are received. A total of 15 attachments are available for review, including a Request for Proposal document.

### Evaluation Criteria
The contract will be awarded based on the "Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price."

### Additional Information
For additional information, please contact Karen Dolan at DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, (782) 377-7245, with attention to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) and any set-aside conditions.

**Download the tender documents:[Links to attachments](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/32811/30004990---rfp_0.pdf)**.
